intro: Dichapetalum cubense, commonly known as the Cuban star-gourd, is a herbaceous plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in humid climates. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are usually white or pale pink. Dichapetalum cubense is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
